channel.title: I can connect to my server but others can't
channel.description: I have a problem that I can connect to my server, but others can't. I've changed all my files to my no-ip IP, port forwarded, and made sure the port was open. I looked at my no-ip DUC and all three things have green check marks. Whenever others try to connect it says "Error Connecting to Server". What am I doing wrong? The server is 317. [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/10pn2ua.jpg[/img]

item.title: I can connect to my server but others can't

item.description:
@Ags_Vs_Claws wrote:

Try portforwading, my mate has this source and that’s all he needed to do…

Read full topic

@totalystylin1 wrote:

ok. try this. go to ur cmd and type ipconfig. and look for ur IP4 ip. and put tht IP for your client’s IP. then compile. Gl. hope this helped.

item.title: I can connect to my server but others can't
item.dc:creator: @AaronxRegen AaronxRegen
item.description:
@AaronxRegen wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:3, topic:433411”][quote author=mr extremez link=topic=536131.msg3920046#msg3920046 date=1329617444]
Lol look at the client run cmd… Something is wrong with your cache
[/quote]
His client is working fine, if you look at the background. He’s running off local host but others can’t connect.

The only thing I can say is make sure that the client and source are running off the same port.[/quote]

Would you happen to know which *.java files or other files have what the ports are set as?

Read full topic

mr extremez:

Lol look at the client run cmd… Something is wrong with your cache

His client is working fine, if you look at the background. He’s running off local host but others can’t connect.

The only thing I can say is make sure that the client and source are running off the same port.
